description: This studio course focuses on the fundamentals of stage direction. Students develop skills of play selection, audience analysis, text interpretation, working with actors, stage picturization and blocking, design considerations, and the process of casting and rehearsals. A primary focus is on developing a point of view about theatre and directing by the study of other directors and theories of theatre. Prerequisites: Theatre 110 or 180, 115 or 130 or 131, and 140. Offered annually in the fall semester.
name: Beginning Stage Direction
prerequisites: Prerequisites: Theatre 110 or 180, 115 or 130 or 131, and 140. Offered annually in the fall semester.
title: Stage Direction
